newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian monetary policy changes since 1990.
newsitem.headline: Australian monetary policy changes since 1990.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of Australia on Friday reduced official interest rate by 0.5 percenage points to a new target rate of 5.50 percent.

The bank announces any changes to the official cash rate at 9.30 a.m. (2330 GMT), when it announces its monetary operation intentions for the day. Rate changes can be made on any day of the month, not necessarily the day after the RBA board meets.
The board normally meets on the first day of every month apart from January, although this can be changed. There is no announcement made if policy is to remain unchanged.
The practice of annoucing changes was introduced in 1990.
Prior to that, there was no official announcements of changes in the official rate. The following table provides a listing of all changes in policy since January 1990.
Date of Direction Size of move New Target
change of change (pct points) cash rate
